trans-unit.source: Runs an external program using the ShellExecute API and pauses script execution until it finishes.

seg-source.mrk: Runs an external program using the ShellExecute API and pauses script execution until it finishes.

target.mrk: Runs an external program using the ShellExecute API and pauses script execution until it finishes.

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The name of the file to run (EXE, .txt, .lnk, etc).

seg-source.mrk: The name of the file to run (EXE, .txt, .lnk, etc).

target.mrk: The name of the file to run (EXE, .txt, .lnk, etc).

trans-unit.source: [optional] Any parameters for the program. Blank ("") uses none.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Any parameters for the program.
Blank ("") uses none.

target.mrk: [optional]
Any parameters for the program.
Blank ("") uses none.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The working directory. Blank ("") uses the current working directory.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The working directory.
Blank ("") uses the current working directory.

target.mrk: [optional]
The working directory.
Blank ("") uses the current working directory.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The "verb" to use, common verbs include:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The "verb" to use, common verbs include:

target.mrk: [optional]
The "verb" to use, common verbs include:

trans-unit.source: $SHEX_OPEN ("open") = Opens the file specified. The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder

seg-source.mrk: $SHEX_OPEN ("open") = Opens the file specified.
The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder

target.mrk: $SHEX_OPEN ("open") = Opens the file specified.
The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder

trans-unit.source: $SHEX_EDIT ("edit") = Launches an editor and opens the document for editing. If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

seg-source.mrk: $SHEX_EDIT ("edit") = Launches an editor and opens the document for editing.
If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

target.mrk: $SHEX_EDIT ("edit") = Launches an editor and opens the document for editing.
If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

trans-unit.source: $SHEX_PRINT ("print") = Prints the document file specified. If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

seg-source.mrk: $SHEX_PRINT ("print") = Prints the document file specified.
If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

target.mrk: $SHEX_PRINT ("print") = Prints the document file specified.
If "filename" is not a document file, the function will fail

trans-unit.source: $SHEX_PROPERTIES ("properties") = Displays the file or folder's properties

seg-source.mrk: $SHEX_PROPERTIES ("properties") = Displays the file or folder's properties

target.mrk: $SHEX_PROPERTIES ("properties") = Displays the file or folder's properties

trans-unit.source: See remarks for more information on the default behavior when a verb is not specified.

seg-source.mrk: See remarks for more information on the default behavior when a verb is not specified.

target.mrk: See remarks for more information on the default behavior when a verb is not specified.

trans-unit.source: Constants are defined in "AutoItConstants.au3".

seg-source.mrk: Constants are defined in "AutoItConstants.au3".

target.mrk: Constants are defined in "AutoItConstants.au3".

trans-unit.source: [optional] The "show" flag of the executed program:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The "show" flag of the executed program:

target.mrk: [optional]
The "show" flag of the executed program:

trans-unit.source: @SW_HIDE = Hidden window

seg-source.mrk: @SW_HIDE = Hidden window

target.mrk: @SW_HIDE = Hidden window

trans-unit.source: @SW_MINIMIZE = Minimized window

seg-source.mrk: @SW_MINIMIZE = Minimized window

target.mrk: @SW_MINIMIZE = Minimized window

trans-unit.source: @SW_MAXIMIZE = Maximized window

seg-source.mrk: @SW_MAXIMIZE = Maximized window

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: the exit code of the program that was run.

seg-source.mrk: the exit code of the program that was run.

target.mrk: the exit code of the program that was run.

trans-unit.source: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: After running the requested program the script pauses until the requested program terminates

seg-source.mrk: After running the requested program the script pauses until the requested program terminates

target.mrk: After running the requested program the script pauses until the requested program terminates

trans-unit.source: When no verb is specified the default verb is used. The default verb is the verb configured in the registry. If no verb is set as default in the registry then the "open" verb is used. If the "open" verb is not present then the first verb listed in the registry is used.

seg-source.mrk: When no verb is specified the default verb is used.
The default verb is the verb configured in the registry.
If no verb is set as default in the registry then the "open" verb is used.
If the "open" verb is not present then the first verb listed in the registry is used.

target.mrk: When no verb is specified the default verb is used.
The default verb is the verb configured in the registry.
If no verb is set as default in the registry then the "open" verb is used.
If the "open" verb is not present then the first verb listed in the registry is used.
